page.content: work. He clips and dips his sheep, de-horns calves, maintains and repairs his farm machinery where possible without outside help. In the winter he is busy maintaining the hedges and fences. The traditional craft of hedging still exists on small farms. The hedges are mainly of hawthorn and blackthorn. The bulk of his land is grass which is used for grazing and for production of silage and hay. The crops he grows are feed corn for his stock i.e. oats or barley and milking wheat to sell. He also grows swedes and fodder beet, the latter for animals and the former to sell and for animals as well. A lot of time is spent re-seeding and improving the grassland.
